intro: Fleurya cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleurya, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in association with other wetland plants. Fleurya cuneata plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
